titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Global Health student projects collection, 2016-2017 RL.11710
titlestmt.author: Meghan Lyon

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-25 08:39:28 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection consists of student projects created through the Duke University course GLHLTH 302: Narratives of Living with HIV/AIDS, taught by Professor Kearsley Stewart in 2016 and 2017.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Duke University professor Kearsley Stewart led the Global Narratives of HIV/AIDS course in 2016 and 2017, where undergraduates in the Global Health program worked with poet/writer Kelley Swain to create Humament-inspired pieces drawn from the Maria de Bruyn Papers, an archival collection in the History of Medicine Collection at Rubenstein Library. "Humament" is a combination of the words "human" and "document" originating from British artist Tom Phillips; Swain has developed workshops on the Humament art book to allow new explorations in historical narratives.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Global Health Student Projects collection was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Global Health Student Projects collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2019-0012

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also the Maria de Bruyn Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of two years of student work from Duke University's Global Narratives of HIV/AIDS course, taught by Kearsley Stewart. The work includes student papers and reflections as well as Humament-inspired artwork inspired by student engagement with the Maria de Bruyn Papers at Rubenstein Library. Some of the artwork was displayed in Perkins Library on the Student Wall in 2016-2017. Student names and titles for their pieces are recorded in the collection's boxes.
